meanings.definition: A woman holding the rank of baron in her own right or by marriage.
meanings.sent1: The baronne attended the royal ball in her elegant gown.
meanings.sent2: The baronne inherited the title from her late husband.
meanings.sent3: The baronne joked that being a noblewoman meant never having to do dishes.
meanings.sent4: She carried herself with the grace and dignity befitting a baronne.
meanings.sent5: The portrait of the baronne hung proudly in the grand hall.

meanings.definition: A title of nobility given to a woman who holds the rank of baron.
meanings.sent1: The king bestowed the title of baronne upon the brave lady.
meanings.sent2: The baronne's family lineage traced back to generations of nobility.
meanings.sent3: At the ceremony, the baronne's hat kept slipping off, causing laughter.
meanings.sent4: Her kindness and generosity made her a true baronne in the eyes of the people.
meanings.sent5: The golden tiara sparkled on the head of the newly appointed baronne.
